revised_title: The Healing Properties of a Stone Found in Serpent Heads
tldr: The article discusses a stone found in the head of a serpent in the East Indies and its ability to heal snakebite wounds. The stone is said to adhere to the wound, drawing out the venom, and then be washed in milk to remove any remaining poison. The author cites various sources, including Monsieur Thevenot, who reported similar findings in his book about diverse voyages.
